name: Giftcard Reward
description: Automate the email of giftcards to eligible recipients

versions.1.0.4: Add token to batch processing needed for Framework 8
versions.1.1.0: Ability to inhibit emails and customize gift card display

crons.cron_description: This cron will run once a day to send project owners a summary of their gift card dispersements
This cron will run once a day at 9am to check for gift card logic statuses which are based on a date.

system-settings.name:
Enable Debug Logging
If you have the Stanford emLogger external module installed and configured, you can enable additional debug-level logging through this checkbox

project-settings.name:
GCR Project ID
This is the project containing all of the gift cards

GCR Event ID
If the Gift Card Repository is longitudinal, specify the numerical Event ID where the form resides
Leave blank for classical. Must be a number.

Alert Email
In the event gift cards are exhausted or any other error occurs, an email will be sent to this email address

CC Email
This email address will be cc'd on all verification emails sent to participants when they become eligible for a reward, when the option is selected. Also, this email will be sent a copy of each Rewards email, when the option is selected. Each configuration has an option for verification and rewards emails so you can pick and choose based on the specific reward.

Styling for Reward Display Pages
The following options allow you to customize the reward display page. The page will default to the following settings if no values are entered below:
  • Header & Footer color (default: #FFFFFF or white)
  • Logo (no image)
  • Background (no image)
  • Table Background Color (default #DAD7CB)

Gift Card Reward Header And Footer Color
(enter hex value or color name such as #0000FF or blue)

Gift Card Reward Logo
(enter URL of image to display)

Gift Card Reward Background Image
(enter URL of image to display)

Gift Card Reward Table Color
(enter hex value or color name such as #0000FF or blue)

Gift Card Instance
Each of the fields below configure a single gift card event from this project.

sub_settings.name:
Reward Settings
The following fields are used to determine when a participant is eligible for an award and how to handle the notification.

Reward Title
A descriptive name for this reward
(e.g. Baseline Complete)

Reward Event ID
Specify the event where the the following fields resides. Cannot be repeating event.

Reward Logic
A gift card will be automatically awarded when this logic is true AND the ID field below is empty

Reward ID Field
Specify a field in this project where the ID of the Gift Card assigned to this reward will be stored

Reward ID Status Field
Specify the field where the reward status should be put

Reward ID URL field
The reward page URL is stored in the library project. The URL can also be stored in this gift card project if a field name is selected here. This field validation is text.

Reward Amount
Specify the dollar amount (number only) for this gift card (ex. 20 for twenty dollars).
Only cards with a matching dollar amount from the GCR will be used.
If left blank, the next card from the GCR will be taken regardless of dollar value.

Brand
Select the field that holds the brand that will be used for filtering gift cards. If empty, brand filtering is not performed. The brand field must be a drop down menu or a radio button selector.

Inhibit emails
When this checkbox is selected, gift card processing will take place to Reserve a gift card for the record but the gift card link will not be sent out in email. This feature can be used when email addresses are not known; so instead, you can display the URL to the gift card to the participant.

Reward Email Address
Enter the email address field from this project where the reward will be sent. This field does not need to be in the same event as the other gift card fields but it cannot be on a repeating form or in a repeating event or in multiple events. This field is required to be filled in unless the 'Inhibit emails from being sent' checkbox above is selected.

Reward Email From
Enter the email address to use in the From field. This field does not need to be filled in when the 'Inhibit emails from being sent' checkbox is selected

Batch Processing
Select this checkbox for batch processing. No gift cards will automatically be sent but a list is of eligible records will be provided from the EM Batch Processing page so you can select the records you want to send gift cards to. Do not select Batch Processing if 'Inhibit emails from being sent' is selected.

Fields to Display for Batch Processing
Comma separately list of fields to display when selecting gift cards to send during batch processing. The fields must reside in this configuration event. This list is only used when 'Batch Processing' above is selected.

Email Settings
The following fields are used to tailor the subject and body of emails going out to participants.

Reward Notification Email Subject
Enter the subject for the reward notification email. This is the email that is sent to a participant when they become eligible for a reward. The gift card is not included in this email, instead, a link to the gift card display is included in this email.
Piping is allowed

Reward Notification Email Body
Enter text to appear before the link to the reward in the body of the email.
Piping is allowed.

CC Reward Notification Email
Check this box if you want each reward notification email to be cc'd to the CC Email address entered above.

Reward Code Email Subject
Enter the subject for the reward email when a participant would like a copy of the reward code.
Piping is allowed

Reward Code Email Body
Enter text to appear before the details of the reward in the body of the email.
Piping is allowed.

CC Reward Email
Check this box if you want each reward email to be cc'd to the CC Email address entered above.

Notification Settings
The following are options to keep you informed about your gift card library. As a default, you will receive email notifications for these events:
  • There are no gifts available but a participant qualifies for one.
  • A daily summary describing the gift card library status.

Opt-Out Low Balance Notification
When Opt-Out Low Balance Notification is checked, email notifications will not be sent to the email address in the Alert Email field when the number of available rewards drops below the threshold number.

Low Balance Threshold
If a number is entered and the checkbox to Opt-Out Low Balance Notifications is not selected, an email will be sent to the Alert Email address when the number of available rewards falls below this number. When left empty, emails will only be sent when a participant is eligible but there are none to send.

Opt-Out Daily Summary
When Opt-Out Daily Summary is checked, the daily report will not be sent to the Alert Email which details the daily activity for the gift card processing project.

Allow Multiple Rewards
When Allow Multiple Rewards is selected, rewards will be sent to an email address that has already received a reward. When this is NOT selected, a reward will not be sent if the same email address was already sent a reward.

Enable 9am cron job to check logic
When checked, this option allows for the 9am cron job to check the gift card reward logic to see if it is true. If true, a giftcard will be dispersed to the participant - same as when a participant record is saved. When left unchecked, the gift card logic check is only performed when the record is saved.
